info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 9:58AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Light Snow With Some Slick Spots Through Midday... Light snow will continue to move southward across portions of eastern Bureau County and Putnam County through midday and possibly produce some slick spots on roads. Untreated pavement and bridges are most likely to be slippery. Visibility may be reduced down to under 2 miles at times. Areas more favored for this snow activity will be along and east of a line from La Moille, to Princeton, and to Putnam. Snow accumulations of a dusting up to a half inch will be possible in these areas until the snow decreases early this afternoon. Use caution and slow down if you are traveling in these areas today. Conditions may vary considerably over short distances, from mainly dry pavement to patches of snow on the roads.
